function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Reliance on literature review and expert discussion may lead to biased or incomplete understanding of pandemic response","Impact":"Misinterpretation or oversight of critical indicators for pandemic resilience","Mitigation":"Include diverse perspectives and conduct thorough validation of selected indicators","Technologies":"Data analysis tools for comprehensive evaluation of indicators","People":"Researchers, experts, and stakeholders involved in the selection process","Owner":"Research team or organization conducting the assessment"},{"Description":"Inadequate coverage of relevant data sources may result in incomplete information","Impact":"Failure to capture important insights and trends related to pandemic resilience in buildings","Mitigation":"Utilize a wide range of reputable data sources and search strategies for comprehensive data collection","Technologies":"Data mining and web scraping tools for systematic collection of information","People":"Research team responsible for sourcing data","Owner":"Research team or organization conducting the assessment"},{"Description":"Overreliance on specific green building certification systems may limit the consideration of alternative approaches to pandemic resilience","Impact":"Narrow perspective on pandemic-resilient factors in buildings, potentially overlooking innovative solutions","Mitigation":"Include non-standardized approaches and emerging frameworks in the assessment","Technologies":"Simulation and modeling tools for evaluating non-traditional resilience strategies","People":"Experts in green building standards and pandemic response","Owner":"Research team or organization conducting the assessment"}]}
